qa_list.question: What are the appointment types offered at this center?
qa_list.answer: The appointment types offered include Video response (asynchronous), Group appointments, and Workshops.

qa_list.question: Who is the target audience for these resources?
qa_list.answer: These resources are designed for graduate students at Carnegie Mellon who are international or nonnative English speakers.

qa_list.question: What kind of sessions can a student choose from to improve their language skills?
qa_list.answer: Students can choose from sessions on giving strong presentations, writing academic emails, analyzing expectations for clear academic writing, talking about oneself as a professional in the U.S., developing clearer pronunciation, using accurate grammar, building fluency, and more.

qa_list.question: What is the role of the Student Academic Success Center?
qa_list.answer: The center's role includes certifying the language proficiency of International Teaching Assistants (ITAs) to ensure they have the necessary skills for teaching in the Carnegie Mellon classroom.

qa_list.question: How long does it take to receive feedback after a scheduled appointment?
qa_list.answer: The feedback video will be received within 5 days after the scheduled appointment.

qa_list.question: What percentage of graduate students at Carnegie Mellon are international students?
qa_list.answer: More than 60% of graduate students at Carnegie Mellon are international students.

qa_list.question: How can a student make an appointment with a Language Development Specialist?
qa_list.answer: Students can make an appointment with a Language Development Specialist to get individualized coaching on language or cross-cultural issues.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of workshops at this center?
qa_list.answer: Workshops are available on a variety of topics and help attendees learn research-backed communication strategies.

qa_list.question: What kind of resources are available for students to improve their language skills?
qa_list.answer: An online collection of handouts and videos that concisely explain specific communication strategies are available as resources.

qa_list.question: What should students preparing for an ITA Certification do from the beginning of their first semester?
qa_list.answer: Students preparing to do an ITA Certification should plan to take classes offered by the language support team at the SASC from the beginning of their first semester.

qa_list.question: Where can students find information about Language Support Orientation?
qa_list.answer: Start by contacting the language support team at the SASC website or attend a Language Support Orientation at the SASC or in your department.

qa_list.question: What is the source of this text?
qa_list.answer: MIIS Graduate Student Handbook, Page 44

qa_list.question: Who should students contact for Language Support Orientation?
qa_list.answer: Students can attend a Language Support Orientation at the SASC or in their department.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of taking classes offered by the language support team from the beginning of the first semester?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of taking classes offered by the language support team from the beginning of the first semester is to prepare for an ITA Certification.

qa_list.question: What should students do if they want more information about Language Support Orientation?
qa_list.answer: Students can contact the language support team at the SASC website or attend a Language Support Orientation in their department.

qa_list.question: Where is the SASC located?
qa_list.answer: The location of the SASC is not mentioned in this text.

qa_list.question: What does ITA stand for?
qa_list.answer: ITA stands for International Teaching Assistant.

qa_list.question: How many semesters are there in a year?
qa_list.answer: The number of semesters in a year is not mentioned in this text.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of Academic Coaching at CMU?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of Academic Coaching at CMU is to provide holistic one-on-one peer support and group workshops to help students find and implement their conditions for success. It assists in improving time management, productive habits, organization, stress management, and study skills.

qa_list.question: How can a student request Academic Coaching at CMU?
qa_list.answer: A student can request support through the Academic Success Center website. They will attend in-person meetings or meet using video and audioconferencing technology to provide all students with support.

qa_list.question: What is Peer Tutoring at CMU?
qa_list.answer: Peer Tutoring offers weekly appointments in a one-on-one and small group format for students from any discipline who need assistance with a course that may not be supported by other services. Students can register online through the Student Academic Success website.

qa_list.question: What is 'Just in Time' Workshops at CMU?
qa_list.answer: The Student Academic Success team partners with instructors and departments to identify skills or concepts that would benefit from supplemental offerings (workshops, boot camps) to support students’ academic success and learning. They are eager to help convene and coordinate outside of the classroom skill-building opportunities open to any student interested in building skill or reinforcing course concept mastery.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of University Libraries at CMU?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of University Libraries at CMU is not mentioned in the given text. Please refer to the official website www.library.cmu.edu for more information.

qa_list.question: How can a student access academic resources from University Libraries?
qa_list.answer: A student can access academic resources from University Libraries by visiting their official website at www.library.cmu.edu.

qa_list.question: What is the role of Academic Success Center in providing support to students?
qa_list.answer: The Academic Success Center provides holistic one-on-one peer support and group workshops to help students find and implement their conditions for success. It assists in improving time management, productive habits, organization, stress management, and study skills.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of 'Just in Time' Workshops at CMU?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of 'Just in Time' Workshops at CMU is to support students’ academic success and learning by partnering with instructors and departments to identify skills or concepts that would benefit from supplemental offerings (workshops, boot camps). They are eager to help convene and coordinate outside of the classroom skill-building opportunities open to any student interested in building skill or reinforcing course concept mastery.

qa_list.question: What is Peer Tutoring at CMU?
qa_list.answer: Peer Tutoring offers weekly appointments in a one-on-one and small group format for students from any discipline who need assistance with a course that may not be supported by other services. Students can register online through the Student Academic Success website.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the University Libraries at CMU?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of the University Libraries at CMU is to support graduate students in their coursework, research, teaching, and publishing by providing access to a wide range of information resources and services.

qa_list.question: What kind of assistance do library liaisons provide?
qa_list.answer: Library liaisons at CMU provide professional assistance and advice in all-things information, including locating and obtaining specific resources, providing specialized research support, and advanced training in the use and management of data.

qa_list.question: What kind of workshops are offered by the University Libraries?
qa_list.answer: The University Libraries offers hands-on topic-specific sessions such as data visualization with Tableau, cleaning data with OpenRefine, and getting started with Zotero.

qa_list.question: What services are available during the weekly drop-in hours for Digital Humanities?
qa_list.answer: During the academic year, there are scheduled weekly drop-in hours for Digital Humanities where students can receive assistance and advice on their research.

qa_list.question: How can a student find the library liaison in their field of study?
qa_list.answer: Students can identify and reach out to the library liaison in their field by visiting the library home page at www.library.cmu.edu.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the Research at CMU website?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of the Research at CMU website is to provide information about research activities and initiatives happening across all schools, departments, and centers at Carnegie Mellon University.

qa_list.question: What does a student need to do to start using Zotero?
qa_list.answer: To get started with Zotero, students should sign up for the workshop offered by the University Libraries and follow the instructions provided during the session.

qa_list.question: What is mentioned in the MIIS Graduate Student Handbook about research at CMU?
qa_list.answer: According to the MIIS Graduate Student Handbook, there is a page dedicated to information about research at CMU.

qa_list.question: What resources can students find on the library home page?
qa_list.answer: Students can find books, journals, databases, and other needed materials in various formats on the library home page. They can also identify and reach out to the library liaison in their field.

qa_list.question: What is the primary purpose of research at the university?
qa_list.answer: The advancement of knowledge in all fields in which the university is active.

qa_list.question: Why is research considered an essential element in education, particularly at the graduate level and in faculty development?
qa_list.answer: Research activities are governed by several university policies. Guidance and more general information can be found by visiting the Research at Carnegie Mellon website.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the Office of Research Integrity & Compliance?
qa_list.answer: The Office of Research Integrity & Compliance (ORIC) supports research at Carnegie Mellon University by ensuring that research is conducted with integrity and in accordance with federal and Pennsylvania regulation.

qa_list.question: What services does the Office of Research Integrity & Compliance provide?
qa_list.answer: The ORIC assists researchers with human subject research, conflicts of interest, responsible conduct of research, export controls, institutional animal care & use and provides consultation, advice, and review of allegations of research misconduct.

qa_list.question: What are the key offices for health, wellness, and safety at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The A.3 Key Offices for Health, Wellness & Safety include Counseling & Psychological Services (CaPS) and Health Services.

qa_list.question: What services does the Counseling & Psychological Services provide to students?
qa_list.answer: Counseling & Psychological Services provides an opportunity for students to talk privately about academic and personal concerns in a safe, confidential setting. They offer initial consultation, referral for counseling within CaPS or another resource at Carnegie Mellon, or to another resource within the larger Pittsburgh community.

qa_list.question: What services does Health Services provide?
qa_list.answer: Health Services provides health-related services such as medical care and support for students' physical wellbeing. More information can be found on their website at www.cmu.edu/HealthServices.

qa_list.question: How can a student make an appointment with Counseling & Psychological Services?
qa_list.answer: Students can make appointments in person or by telephone at 412-268-2922. They also provide workshops and group sessions on mental health related topics specifically for graduate students.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the Health Services website?
qa_list.answer: The Health Services website provides information about the services they offer, including medical care and support for students' physical wellbeing. It also includes resources on health-related topics such as immunizations, insurance, and emergency procedures.

qa_list.question: What services does University Health Services provide?
qa_list.answer: University Health Services provides general medical care, allergy injections, first aid, gynecological care and contraception as well as on-site pharmaceuticals.

qa_list.question: Who staffs University Health Services?
qa_list.answer: University Health Services is staffed by physicians, advanced practice clinicians, and registered nurses.

qa_list.question: What does the CMU Student Insurance Plan cover?
qa_list.answer: The CMU Student Insurance Plan covers most visit fees to see the physicians and advanced practice clinicians & nurse visits. Fees for prescription medications, laboratory tests, diagnostic procedures and referral to the emergency room or specialists are the student’s responsibility.

qa_list.question: Where is this information found?
qa_list.answer: This information can be found in the MIIS Graduate Student Handbook on page 46.

qa_list.question: What kind of care does University Health Services provide for gynecological issues?
qa_list.answer: University Health Services provides gynecological care and contraception services.

qa_list.question: Is the cost of prescription medications covered by the CMU Student Insurance Plan?
qa_list.answer: No, the cost of prescription medications is not covered by the CMU Student Insurance Plan. The student has to bear this expense.

qa_list.question: What kind of medical care does University Health Services provide for emergency situations?
qa_list.answer: University Health Services provides referral services for students in need of emergency room or specialist care, but the cost is not covered by the CMU Student Insurance Plan.

qa_list.question: What kind of diagnostic procedures does University Health Services cover?
qa_list.answer: University Health Services covers laboratory tests and diagnostic procedures. However, these services are not included in the CMU Student Insurance Plan.

qa_list.question: Who is responsible for paying referral fees to emergency rooms or specialists?
qa_list.answer: The student is responsible for paying referral fees to emergency rooms or specialists. This expense is not covered by the CMU Student Insurance Plan.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of UHS at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: UHS provides direct health care and administers the Student Health Insurance Program. It also has a registered dietician and health promotion specialists on staff to assist students in addressing nutrition, drug and alcohol issues.

qa_list.question: How can students make appointments at UHS?
qa_list.answer: Students can make appointments by visiting the UHS website, walk-in or by telephone (412-268-2157).

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of BeWell@CMU e-newsletter?
qa_list.answer: BeWell@CMU e-newsletter seeks to be a comprehensive resource for CMU regarding all wellness-inspired events, announcements and professional and personal development opportunities.

qa_list.question: Who should students contact to sign up for the Be Well monthly newsletter?
qa_list.answer: Students can sign up for the Be Well monthly newsletter by contacting the Program Director for Student Affairs Wellness Initiatives at alusk@andrew.cmu.edu.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of Religious and Spiritual Life Initiatives (RSLI) at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: Religious and Spiritual Life Initiatives provide a variety of wellness, mindfulness and connectedness initiatives and resources designed to help students thrive inside and outside the classroom.

qa_list.question: What is the website for Religious and Spiritual Life Initiatives (RSLI) at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The website for Religious and Spiritual Life Initiatives (RSLI) at Carnegie Mellon University is www.cmu.edu/student-affairs/spirituality.

qa_list.question: What does the university believe about individual and collective well-being?
qa_list.answer: At Carnegie Mellon, we believe our individual and collective well-being is rooted in healthy connections to each other and to campus resources.

qa_list.question: What kind of initiatives does the university provide for students' wellness?
qa_list.answer: The university provides a wide variety of wellness, mindfulness and connectedness initiatives designed to help students thrive inside and outside the classroom.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of A.3.3 Campus Wellness section?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of A.3.3 Campus Wellness section is to provide information about wellness, mindfulness and connectedness initiatives and resources at Carnegie Mellon University.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of Religious and Spiritual Life Initiatives (RSLI) at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of RSLI at CMU is to provide opportunities for spiritual and religious practice and exploration, support students across various religious traditions, and increase knowledge and appreciation for diverse worldview traditions.

qa_list.question: What services does the University Police Department offer?
qa_list.answer: The University Police Department offers police patrols and call response, criminal investigations, fixed officer and foot officer patrols, event security, and crime prevention and education programming.

qa_list.question: Where is the location of the University Police Department?
qa_list.answer: The University Police Department is located at 4551 Filmore Street.

qa_list.question: What kind of programs and initiatives does RSLI offer that cross traditional religious boundaries?
qa_list.answer: RSLI offers programs and initiatives that increase knowledge and appreciation for the full diversity of worldview traditions, crossing traditional religious boundaries.

qa_list.question: How can students make a connection into a community of faith during their time at CMU?
qa_list.answer: Students can make a connection into a community of faith with the help of RSLI staff, who are here to support them across the spectrum of religious and spiritual practice.

qa_list.question: What is the contact information for University Police Department?
qa_list.answer: The contact number for University Police Department is 412-268-2323.

qa_list.question: Is there a Graduate Student Handbook at MIIS?
qa_list.answer: Yes, there is a Graduate Student Handbook available for MIIS students.

qa_list.question: Where can students find more information about RSLI initiatives and programs?
qa_list.answer: Students can find more information about RSLI initiatives and programs on the website www.cmu.edu/student-affairs/spirituality.

qa_list.question: What is the location of MIIS Graduate Student Handbook?
qa_list.answer: The location of MIIS Graduate Student Handbook is not specified in the given text.

qa_list.question: What services does Parking and Transportation provide for CMU students, faculty, and community?
qa_list.answer: Parking and Transportation provides the Shuttle Service and Escort Service.

qa_list.question: Where can graduate students obtain a copy of Carnegie Mellon University's annual campus security and fire safety report?
qa_list.answer: Graduate students can obtain a copy by contacting the University Police Department at 412-268-2323.

qa_list.question: What is The WORD in Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The WORD is Carnegie Mellon University’s student handbook and serves as the foundation for the department (and sometimes college) handbook.

qa_list.question: What information can be found in The WORD at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The WORD contains university-wide academic policy information and resources, community policies and resources, and describes the university level procedures used to review possible violations of these standards.

qa_list.question: Where can students find full text of Carnegie Mellon University's policies?
qa_list.answer: Students can find full text of university policies at http://www.cmu.edu/policies/. The WORD also includes information about these policies.

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of The WORD in Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The purpose of The WORD is to provide all students with the tools, guidance, and insights to help you achieve your full potential as a member of the Carnegie Mellon community.

qa_list.question: What services does Parking and Transportation coordinate for CMU?
qa_list.answer: Parking and Transportation coordinates Shuttle Service and Escort Service provided for CMU students, faculty, and community.

qa_list.question: Where can students find information about the stops, routes, tracking, and schedules of the Shuttle and Escort Services?
qa_list.answer: Students can find full information about these services at https://www.cmu.edu/parking/transport/shuttle.html.

qa_list.question: What is the website for The WORD in Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The website for The WORD is http://www.cmu.edu/student-affairs/theword//

qa_list.question: What is the name of the handbook mentioned in the text?
qa_list.answer: The MIIS Graduate Student Handbook

qa_list.question: In which page of the handbook is the information located?
qa_list.answer: Page 48

qa_list.question: What are the educational goals mentioned in the text?
qa_list.answer: Academic and Individual Freedom, Academic Disciplinary Actions Overview

qa_list.question: What is Carnegie Mellon Vision according to the text?
qa_list.answer: Carnegie Mellon Code

qa_list.question: What does the mission statement of assurance in the text refer to?
qa_list.answer: Academic Standards, Policies and Procedures

qa_list.question: What is the purpose of the academic disciplinary actions overview mentioned in the text?
qa_list.answer: To provide an outline or summary of academic disciplinary actions

qa_list.question: What does MIIS stand for according to the text?
qa_list.answer: MIIS Graduate Student Handbook

qa_list.question: What is the main topic of discussion in the text?
qa_list.answer: The academic policies, procedures and standards at Carnegie Mellon Vision

qa_list.question: What does the text mention about individual freedom according to the educational goals mentioned?
qa_list.answer: Individual Freedom is one of the educational goals

qa_list.question: What are the topics covered in this text?
qa_list.answer: The text covers various academic policies and resources available for students at a university.

qa_list.question: Which policy is discussed regarding final exams for graduate courses?
qa_list.answer: The Grading Policies are mentioned in the context of final exams for graduate courses.

qa_list.question: What office handles alleged misconduct of research at this university?
qa_list.answer: The Policy on Restricted Research is discussed, which mentions the Office of Sponsored Programs as the one handling alleged misconduct of research.

qa_list.question: What kind of assistance does the university offer for individuals with disabilities?
qa_list.answer: The text provides information about Assistance for Individuals with Disabilities, which is a campus resource available to students.

qa_list.question: How are student's privacy rights protected at this university?
qa_list.answer: The Privacy Rights of Students policy is mentioned in the text as one that protects student's privacy rights.

qa_list.question: What kind of awards can graduate students receive and their tax status?
qa_list.answer: The Tax Status of Graduate Student Awards is discussed, which explains that these awards are considered as income for tax purposes.

qa_list.question: Where can students find information about the university's research policies?
qa_list.answer: The text mentions two offices related to research: Office of Research Integrity & Compliance and Office of Sponsored Programs, where students can find information on various research policies.

qa_list.question: What is the name of the handbook that contains all these academic policies for graduate students?
qa_list.answer: The MIIS Graduate Student Handbook is mentioned as a resource containing all these academic policies and resources for graduate students.

qa_list.question: What kind of assistance does the university offer to support student's physical fitness?
qa_list.answer: The text provides information about Athletics, Physical Fitness & Recreation as a campus resource that supports student's physical fitness.

qa_list.question: What is the name of the center that offers assistance for individuals with disabilities?
qa_list.answer: The Leonard Gelfand Center is mentioned in the text as a university resource offering assistance to individuals with disabilities.

qa_list.question: What are the policies related to bicycle/wheeled transportation at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The Bicycle/Wheeled Transportation Policy outlines rules and regulations for using wheeled vehicles on campus.

qa_list.question: What is the policy regarding discriminatory harassment at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The Non-Discrimination Policy states that any form of discriminatory harassment will not be tolerated and can lead to disciplinary action.

qa_list.question: What is the protocol for dealing with missing students at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The Missing Student Protocol outlines procedures that are followed when a student has been absent from classes or activities without notification to the university.

qa_list.question: What is the policy regarding smoking at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The Smoking Policy prohibits smoking in all indoor spaces and within 25 feet of building entrances, exits, and windows.

qa_list.question: What is the policy regarding on-campus emergencies at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The On-Campus Emergencies protocol outlines procedures for responding to various types of campus emergencies, including medical and safety hazards.

qa_list.question: What is the policy regarding freedom of expression at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The Freedom of Expression Policy states that students have the right to express their opinions freely, but this does not extend to harassment or discrimination.

qa_list.question: What is the policy regarding equal opportunity and affirmative action at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Policy states that the university is committed to providing equal opportunities for all students, regardless of their race, gender, or other characteristics.

qa_list.question: What are the policies related to alcohol and drugs at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The Alcohol and Drugs Policy outlines rules and regulations regarding the use of alcohol and drugs on campus, including penalties for violations.

qa_list.question: What is the policy regarding damages to Carnegie Mellon University property?
qa_list.answer: The Damage to Carnegie Mellon Property protocol outlines procedures and potential consequences for students who cause damage to university property.

qa_list.question: What is the policy regarding medical assistance at Carnegie Mellon University?
qa_list.answer: The Active Medical Assistance Protocol provides guidelines for how the university responds to emergency situations involving students' health and well-being.

doc_text:
back. See the appointment types offered.
Video response (asynchronous)--Clients upload documents in advance, then receive a 20- to 30-minute recorded video with a consultant's feedback. The feedback video will be received within 5 days after the scheduled appointment.
Group appointments--Participate with your group to accomplish peer reviews or focus on collaborative presentation strategies.
Workshops--Workshops are available on a variety of topics and help attendees learn research-backed communication strategies. ● Resources--An online collection of handouts and videos that concisely explain specific communication strategies are available.
A.2.2.2 Language and Cross-cultural Support: More than 60% of graduate students at Carnegie Mellon are international students, and others are nonnative speakers of English who have attended high school or undergraduate programs in the US. Many of these students want to hone their language and cross-cultural skills for academic and professional success. Students can make an appointment with a Language Development Specialist to get individualized coaching on language or cross- cultural issues. Students can choose from sessions on ● giving how to give a strong presentation, ● writing academic emails, ● analyzing expectations and strategies for clear academic writing, ● talking how to talk about oneself yourself as a professional in the U.S., ● developing clearer pronunciation, ● using accurate grammar, ● building fluency, and more. ● Students can make an appointment with a Language Development Specialist to get individualized coaching on language or cross-cultural issues. The Student Academic Success Center is also charged with certifying the language of International Teaching Assistants (ITAs), ensuring that nonnative English speakers have the language proficiency needed to succeed as teaching assistants in the Carnegie Mellon classroom.
Students preparing to do an ITA Certification should plan to take classes offered by the language support team at the SASC from the beginning of their first semester. Start by contacting the language support team at the SASC website or attend a Language Support Orientation at the SASC or in your department.
MIIS Graduate Student Handbook
Page 44


A.2.2.3 Learning Support Academic Coaching: Academic Coaching provides holistic one-on-one peer support and group workshops to help students find and implement their conditions for success. We assist students in improving time management, productive habits, organization, stress management, and study skills. Students will request support through the Academic Success Center website and attend in-person meetings or meet using video and audioconferencing technology to provide all students with support.
Peer Tutoring: Weekly Tutoring Appointments are offered in a one-on-one and small group format to students from any discipline who need assistance with a course that may not be supported by our other services. Weekly appointments give students the opportunity to interact regularly with the same tutor to facilitate deeper understanding of concepts. Students can register online through the Student Academic Success website.
“Just in Time” Workshops: The Student Academic Success team is available to partner with instructors and departments to identify skills or concepts that would benefit from supplemental offerings (workshops, boot camps) to support students’ academic success and learning. We are eager to help convene and coordinate outside of the classroom skill-building opportunities that can be open to any student interested in building skill or reinforcing course concept mastery.
A.2.3 University Libraries
www.library.cmu.edu
The University Libraries offers a wide range of information resources and services supporting graduate students in course-work, research, teaching, and publishing. The library licenses and purchases books, journals, media and other needed materials in various formats. Library liaisons, consultants and information specialists provide in-depth and professional assistance and advice in all-things information - including locating and obtaining specific resources, providing specialized research support, advanced training in the use and management of data. Sign up for workshops and hands-on topic-specific sessions such as data visualization with Tableau, cleaning data with OpenRefine, and getting started with Zotero. Weekly drop-in hours for Digital Humanities and for Research Data Research Management are scheduled during the academic year. Start at the library home page to find the books, journals and databases you need; to identify and reach out to the library liaison in your field; to sign up for scheduled workshops; and to connect with consultants in scholarly publishing, research data management, and digital humanities.
A.2.4 Research at CMU
www.cmu.edu/research/index.shtml
MIIS Graduate Student Handbook
Page 45


The primary purpose of research at the university is the advancement of knowledge in all fields in which the university is active. Research is regarded as one of the university’s major contributions to society and as an essential element in education, particularly at the graduate level and in faculty development. Research activities are governed by several university policies. Guidance and more general information are found by visiting the Research at Carnegie Mellon website.
A.2.5 Office of Research Integrity & Compliance
www.cmu.edu/research-compliance/index.html
The Office of Research Integrity & Compliance (ORIC) is designed to support research at Carnegie Mellon University. The staff work with researchers to ensure research is conducted with integrity and in accordance with federal and Pennsylvania regulation. ORIC assists researchers with human subject research, conflicts of interest, responsible conduct of research, export controls, and institutional animal care & use. ORIC also provides consultation, advice, and review of allegations of research misconduct.
A.3 Key Offices for Health, Wellness & Safety
A.3.1 Counseling & Psychological Services
https://www.cmu.edu/counseling/
Counseling & Psychological Services (CaPS) affords the opportunity for students to talk privately about academic and personal concerns in a safe, confidential setting. An initial consultation at CaPS can help clarify the nature of the concern, provide immediate support, and explore further options if needed. These may include a referral for counseling within CaPS, to another resource at Carnegie Mellon, or to another resource within the larger Pittsburgh community. CaPS also provides workshops and group sessions on mental health related topics specifically for graduate students on campus. CaPS services are provided at no cost. Appointments can be made in person, or by telephone at 412-268-2922.
A.3.2 Health Services
www.cmu.edu/HealthServices/
University Health Services (UHS) is staffed by physicians, advanced practice clinicians and registered nurses who provide general medical care, allergy injections, first aid, gynecological care and contraception as well as on-site pharmaceuticals. The CMU Student Insurance Plan covers most visit fees to see the physicians and advanced practice clinicians & nurse visits. Fees for prescription medications, laboratory tests, diagnostic procedures and referral to the emergency room or specialists are the student’s
MIIS Graduate Student Handbook
Page 46


responsibility and students should review the UHS website and their insurance plan for detailed information about the university health insurance requirement and fees. UHS also has a registered dietician and health promotion specialists on staff to assist students in addressing nutrition, drug and alcohol and other healthy lifestyle issues. In addition to providing direct health care, UHS administers the Student Health Insurance Program. The Student Health Insurance plan offers a high level of coverage in a wide network of health care providers and hospitals. Appointments can be made by visiting UHS’s website, walk-in, or by telephone, 412-268-2157.
A.3.3 Campus Wellness
https://www.cmu.edu/wellness/
At Carnegie Mellon, we believe our individual and collective well-being is rooted in healthy connections to each other and to campus resources. The university provides a wide variety of wellness, mindfulness and connectedness initiatives and resources designed to help students thrive inside and outside the classroom. The BeWell@CMU e-newsletter seeks to be a comprehensive resource for CMU regarding all wellness- inspired events, announcements and professional and personal development opportunities. Sign up for the Be Well monthly newsletter by contacting the Program Director for Student Affairs Wellness Initiatives, at alusk@andrew.cmu.edu.
A.3.4 Religious and Spiritual Life Initiatives (RSLI)
www.cmu.edu/student-affairs/spirituality
Carnegie Mellon is committed to the holistic growth of our students, including creating opportunities for spiritual and religious practice and exploration. We have relationships with local houses of worship from various traditions and many of these groups are members of CMU’s Council of Religious Advisors. We also offer programs and initiatives that cross traditional religious boundaries in order to increase knowledge of and appreciation for the full diversity of the worldview traditions. Our RSLI staff are here to support students across the spectrum of religious and spiritual practice and would be more than happy to help you make a connection into a community of faith during your time at CMU.
A.3.5 University Police
http://www.cmu.edu/police/
412-268-2323 The University Police Department is located at 4551 Filmore Street. The department’s services include police patrols and call response, criminal investigations, fixed officer and foot officer patrols, event security, and crime prevention and education programming as
MIIS Graduate Student Handbook
Page 47


well as bicycle and laptop registration. Visit the department’s website for additional information about the staff, emergency phone locations, crime prevention, lost and found, fingerprint services, and annual statistic reports. Carnegie Mellon University publishes an annual campus security and fire safety report describing the university’s security, alcohol and drug, sexual assault, and fire safety policies and containing statistics about the number and type of crimes committed on the campus and the number and cause of fires in campus residence facilities during the preceding three years. Graduate students can obtain a copy by contacting the University Police Department at 412- 268-2323. The annual security and fire safety report is also available online at https://www.cmu.edu/police/annualreports/.
A.3.6 Shuttle and Escort Services
Parking and Transportation coordinates the Shuttle Service and Escort Service provided for CMU students, faculty, and community. The Shuttle & Escort website (https://www.cmu.edu/parking/transport/shuttle.html) has full information about these services, stops, routes, tracking and schedules.
A.4 The WORD
http://www.cmu.edu/student-affairs/theword//
The WORD is Carnegie Mellon University’s student handbook and serves as the foundation for the department (and sometimes college) handbook. The WORD contains university-wide academic policy information and resources, community policies and resources, and describes the university level procedures used to review possible violations of these standards. It is designed to provide all students with the tools, guidance, and insights to help you achieve your full potential as a member of the Carnegie Mellon community. Information about the following is included in The WORD (not an exhaustive list) and graduate students are encouraged to bookmark this site and refer to it often. University policies can also be found in full text at: http://www.cmu.edu/policies/.
